intro: Trema timorense var. pallidum, commonly known as the pale trema, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Timor and nearby regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, pale green leaves and produces clusters of small, white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and limited distribution.
